result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony R Black was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
  All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations to be paid in full within 5 months.
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

NO CONTACT with Daniel Schuppe or his place of employment
NO CONTACT with Tom's Burned Down Cafe except as approved by Department of Corrections. 
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Offer to Settle

Defendant Anthony R Black in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement for the parties.. Atty comments Def is in a tree service business and wondering if he would have to turn down employment if offered a job where vic works.  Count 1 now disorderly conduct.947.01(1)? Count 2 crim. damage to property. Understands charges and penalties. PLEADS NC to count 1 and 2. COunt 3 is DRI. signed PQ. No mind altering substance, understands rights. Wants ct to accept pleas of NC. Ct accepts pleas and finds G. ADA comments no prior record, no rest. thinks agreement is appt. Atty comments def has no prior record. CT ORDERS--- Sentence is withheld for 1 year, report to DOC 24hrs, no contact with Danile Schuppe or place of employment, no contact with Toms burned down Cafe as approved by DOC. Rest TBD, CT 1 10 fine and costs- $488.88 and count 2 ct costs only- $465.15, 2 days jail and credit for 2 days, counseling by DOC, contact jail in 7 days for DNA, pay in full within 5 months.

Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Hoffmann offer to settle, close to settlement. DAP, authorization revoked.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2017 at 03:15 pm.
